meanings.definition: A representation or image, especially of a sacred person or event.
meanings.sent1: The eikon of the saint was displayed in the church.
meanings.sent2: The eikon of the Virgin Mary was beautifully painted.
meanings.sent3: The eikon seemed to wink mischievously at the visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an eikon of joy, brightening the room.
meanings.sent5: The eikon of peace in the painting brought a sense of calm to all who gazed upon it.

meanings.definition: An object of worship or veneration, typically a religious icon.
meanings.sent1: The ancient eikon was revered by generations of believers.
meanings.sent2: The eikon in the temple was adorned with precious gems.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to sneak a peek at the eikon during the ceremony.
meanings.sent4: Her wisdom was an eikon that guided many through difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The eikon of the deity seemed to radiate divine energy, filling the room with awe.

meanings.definition: A symbol or emblem that represents a person or concept.
meanings.sent1: The company logo served as an eikon of their brand identity.
meanings.sent2: The national flag was considered an eikon of patriotism.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel saw the acorn as an eikon of treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an eikon of happiness, spreading joy to all around.
meanings.sent5: The eikon of love in the sculpture captured the essence of affection in a single image.
